attributes.action: Fix bridge issue on Pentrebach Road before someone gets killed in floods!
attributes.additional_details: Because it’s a public road that the council have to maintain. It’s a concern for public safety.
attributes.background: Force the local council to fix the problem, they keep putting temporary measures which last one storm then it starts again. Young children have to wade through it to get to school, cars constantly getting flooded trying to cross it. Someone is going to end up being killed in the water flow.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. 
 
Decisions about bridges are a matter for your local council, not the UK Government or Parliament.
